intro: Codonoboea rugosa, commonly known as the rough codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
